people. Remember when Sen. Bernie Sanders John Boehner promised a 100 Billion in spending cuts just in the first year if they won in Nov. 2010. Here is the actual quote from their" Pledge to America". With common-sense exceptions for seniors, veterans, and our troops, we will roll back government spending to prestimulus, pre-bailout levels, saving us at least$ 100 billion in the first year alone and putting us on a path to begin paying down the debt, balancing the budget, and ending the spending spree in Washington that threatens our children's future . Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, D.C., about an implant that would let Google Inc. know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google Inc. 's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, and an implant would cross the line. He also said that as users voluntarily share information online, it doesn't need users to type in search queries for the company to tailor the results."

8.44 billion for the quarter ended December 31, 2010, representing an increase of 26% compared to Q4 of 2009." Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year," enthuses Eric Schmidt . Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth, investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider Web. Breaking things down, Google-owned Websites accounted for the majority of the revenue generated at US$ 5.67 billion or 67%; up 28% from Q4 2009. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2.
